intro: Glaucium vitellinum, commonly known as the yellow hellebore, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has smooth, waxy leaves that are typically lobed or divided, and it produces capsules that contain numerous small, dark seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
